how-to-make-a-prediction-of-sales-given-.text: How to make a prediction of sales given the levels of the three advertising media budgets?

pageProps.body:
Multiplelinearregression

Multiple Linear Regression

Sw03

Example with advertising. Sales ~ TV looks good with a logloglog transformation of the response variable.

t-statistics = coefficient / std.error

How to make a prediction of sales given the levels of the three advertising media budgets?

Add further coefficiant

Y=β0+β1X1+β2X2+...+βnXn+ϵY = \beta_0 + \beta_1 X_1 + \beta_2 X_2 + ... + \beta_n X_n + \epsilonY=β0​+β1​X1​+β2​X2​+...+βn​Xn​+ϵ

Example

sales=β0+β1TV+β2radio+βnnewspaper+ϵ→graphical representation impossible\text{sales} = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \text{TV} + \beta_2 \text{radio} + \beta_n \text{newspaper} + \epsilon \to \text{graphical representation impossible}sales=β0​+β1​TV+β2​radio+βn​newspaper+ϵ→graphical representation impossible

RSS=∑i=1nri2→r=(yi−β1^xi1−β2^xi2...)2\text{RSS} = \sum_{i = 1}^{n} r^2_i \to r = (y_i - \hat{\beta_1} x_{i 1} - \hat{\beta_2} x_{i 2} ...)^2RSS=∑i=1n​ri2​→r=(yi​−β1​^​xi1​−β2​^​xi2​...)2

No statistical evidence Page 9 - Newspapers coefficiant is 0 - p value quite hight - null hypothsis can not be rejected -- Newspapers correlates with Radio or TV data

Do all predictors X1X_1X1​ to XnX_nXn​ help to get the response variable or only a subset of them? How well does the model fit the data?

E(RSSn−p−1)=σ2=E(TSS−RSSp)→if the null hypothesis is trueE(\frac{\text{RSS}}{n - p - 1}) = \sigma^2 = E(\frac{\text{TSS} - \text{RSS}}{p}) \to \text{if the null hypothesis is true}E(n−p−1RSS​)=σ2=E(pTSS−RSS​)→if the null hypothesis is true else it would be E(TSS−RSSp)>σ2E(\frac{\text{TSS} - \text{RSS}}{p}) > \sigma^2E(pTSS−RSS​)>σ2 ! Where p is the number of predictor variables !

F statistics with a value of 570 means we can reject the null hypothesis in Multiple Linear Regression

How well does it fit?

R2=Corr(Y,Y^)2R^2 = Corr(Y, \hat{Y})^2R2=Corr(Y,Y^)2

The more variables you include into the model, the higher is the expected R^2 value

Dont always look to the R^2 value - look as well to the residual plots

F Test

Qualitative Variables

Qualitativevariables

Additivity vs Interaction

Additivity is not fullfilled in the following example To fix this, we can add an interaction term

The r2r^2r2 value with the interaction term is much higher than the one without interraction term If you invest into radio - the next investement into tv will be more effective! (β1^+β2^∗radio)=1.9+1.1∗radio(\hat{\beta_1} + \hat{\beta_2} * \text{radio}) = 1.9 + 1.1 * radio(β1​^​+β2​^​∗radio)=1.9+1.1∗radio

See example for income with qualitative variable student Slope of the regression line changes

noteIndex.title: Root
noteIndex.body:
# Welcome to Dendron

This is the root of your dendron vault. If you decide to publish your entire vault, this will be your landing page. You are free to customize any part of this page except the frontmatter on top.

## Lookup

This section contains useful links to related resources.

- [Getting Started Guide](https://link.dendron.so/6b25)
- [Discord](https://link.dendron.so/6b23)
- [Home Page](https://wiki.dendron.so/)
- [Github](https://link.dendron.so/6b24)
- [Developer Docs](https://docs.dendron.so/)
